title: RPG Maker Games
description: My first ever experience in an online community was in a tight-knit RPG Maker subforum of an emulation website.

children.title: Pokémon Police
children.description: One of the first prototype games I've ever shared online was a Pokémon fangame, inspired by Pokémon Ranger.

children.title: Sonic the Hedgehog 6 (feathuring RPG)
children.description: This was a Sonic the Hedgehog fangame prototype that didn't get too far into development.

children.title: Freedom Fighters 【Sonic the Hedgehog】✗
children.description: A Sonic fangame inspired by the Archie comics, Sonic Underground and the Sonic Nebulous fangame.

children.title: RPG Táctico Isométrico [Multiplataforma]
children.description: My first game prototype not based on an existing franchise, but instead a first try to implement a turn-based tactical battle system into RPG Maker.

children.title: Ambientación y Armonía
children.description: A series of guides and tutorials on how to apply environmentmental VFX into RPG Maker.

children.title: ◊ Cry of Fate ◊
children.description: First iteration shared of a basic turn-based RPG I first came up with around december of 2010.

children.title: Cry of Fate
children.description: A second iteration of my previous RPG idea, this time with a playable demo.

title: Digital publications
description: I've written a few articles for a digital magazine at a RPG Maker forum.

children.title: Revista Universo Maker
children.description: Around april 2011, a friend and I made a RPG Maker forum using Foroactivo. Later that year, the staff at that forum made a zine talking about the spanish-speaking RPG Maker scene.

title: Creative writing
description: I first discovered I liked roleplaying games at a system-agnostic narrative fantasy forum around 2011.

children.title: La travesía de Lokal
children.description: As a teen I played a lot of both Dofus and Wakfu, and after a friend shared a RP they posted onto their forums, I decided I wanted to try my hand at it too.

children.title: Tristán de Tincoras
children.description: The first character sheet I made in the Cuentos de Noreth forum. To this day I still use this character in my creative writing.

children.title: Gwaew
children.description: I Cuentos de Noreth, it was customary to write a short story called Hijra as an introduction to your character and writing style.

children.title: Ament Fordye
children.description: The second character I made in Cuentos de Noreth. This would become a very beloved character, and is still one of the protagonists of some of the stories I'm working on.

children.title: Sentencia
children.description: The Hijra for my second character, which served the same function as both backstory and training the character voice.

children.title: La tumba del héroe
children.description: First campaign I DMed as, which lasted a few months and introduced me to narrative-driven collaborative TTRPGing.

children.title: La casa del lobo
children.description: A short story featuring my Ament character, which served as a starting point for future campaigns.

children.title: La Orden de los Bravos
children.description: A campaign I played in, which also served as an introduction to a faction one of my character was aligned with.

children.title: El mal menor
children.description: A short story inspired by the Witcher III trailer.

title: Art
description: In the long years I've been on the internet, I've shared my art on a few different platforms.

children.title: Museo Brisantino
children.description: The first art I shared online was for my and my friend's characters in the Dofus game.

children.title: Galería de un Tymador
children.description: A second post sharing my and my friends' OCs in the Dofus forums.

children.title: Galería de Brisant
children.description: After years of playing Dofus with my friend, Ankama Games launched a sequel called Wakfu which I play to this day. Naturally, I also started to draw our characters in that game.

children.title: Chibis Dopeul
children.description: After playing Wakfu for a while, my friends and I created a guild and I made some art of the adventures we had.

children.title: Deviantart gallery
children.description: I used to use Deviantart to share all of my art. It has some really old fanart and some more recent art I made.

children.title: Tumblr gallery
children.description: Tumblr is my favourite social media, and a lot of it has to do with the thriving art community. I made a blog there with all the art I made in recent years.
